# Why Openwrt?
I have 10 years old TP Link router `Archer C7`. Well,... this brand you know, MIC, lot of unfixed firmware vulnerabilities, backdoor. 
For example [CVE-2020-35575](https://www.opencve.io/cve/CVE-2020-35575), the official Archer C7 v2 firmware latest update is released in 2018...  I highly suspect this is NOT patched. Apart from the security concern, the stock firmware seem unstable for daily use, e.g. WIFI signal / network will suddenly down with unknown reason. Openwrt can mostly get rid of these kind of issue, and provide better user experience.    

# Installation
The most easy way to install is download the complied binary from Openwrt [official website](https://openwrt.org/toh/views/toh_fwdownload), and flashing the rom via WebUI. OEM / Openwrt LuCI both have this feature, otherwise you may need to install it via ssh, or even serial for older router model.   
![openwrt_install.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/openwrt_install_bd7fc59ac1.png)
ðŸš¨Use `Install` url if your router is using OEM stock firmware to Openwrt.   
ðŸš¨Use `Upgrade` url if your is using Openwrt, for upgrade purpose.   

# LuCI
LuCI is a Web user interface for Openwrt written in Lua script language. For most of the packages you can find the corresponding `luci-app-xxx` packages so that you can install & use them with web UI via LuCI instead of using the tool via ssh command line.   
Before install package, you should click the `Update lists` button to sync latest packages.   
![luci-install-packages.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/luci_install_packages_4830651593.png)


# Opkg
The package manager of openwrt. If you are familar with Linux, you can treat it something like `apt`, `pacman`.   
To install package via ssh command line:
```bash
ssh root@192.168.x.x   # your gateway address

# sync package list
opkg update
# show all packages
opkg list
# install something
opkg install {package name}
```

# Awesome Packages
## luci-app-nlbwmon
[luci-app-nlbwmon](https://openwrt.org/docs/guide-user/services/network_monitoring/bwmon) - network monitoring tools showing each connected host traffic (download / upload bytes)   
`Services -> Bandwidth Monitor`
![luci_admin_services_nlbw.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/luci_admin_services_nlbw_b453d32f83.png)

## luci-app-dns-https-proxy
[luci-app-dns-https-proxy](https://openwrt.org/docs/guide-user/services/dns/doh_dnsmasq_https-dns-proxy) - force DNS query over https (DoT)   
`Services -> DNS HTTPS Proxy`
![luci_admin_services_https-dns-proxy.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/luci_admin_services_https_dns_proxy_edc95d0253.png)

## luci-app-statistics
[luci-app-statistics](https://openwrt.org/docs/guide-user/luci/luci_app_statistics) - show router hardware resources usage   
`Statistics -> Graphs`   
![luci-app-stat.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/luci_app_stat_efc09b6483.png)
## luci-app-vnstat2
[luci-app-vnstat2](https://openwrt.org/packages/pkgdata/luci-app-vnstat2) - network monitoring tools showing router interface traffic   
`Status -> VnStat Traffic Monitor`
![luci_admin_status_vnstat2.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/luci_admin_status_vnstat2_c2540a51a8.png)

## luci-theme-argon
[luci-theme-argon](https://github.com/jerrykuku/luci-theme-argon) - extremely beautiful theme for Openwrt LuCI, require using command line to install   
```bash
ssh root@192.168.x.x # your gateway address

opkg update
opkg install luci-compat
opkg install luci-lib-ipkg

URL=$(wget -q https://api.github.com/repos/jerrykuku/luci-theme-argon/releases/latest -O - | aw
k -F \" -v RS="," '/browser_download_url/ && /-argon/ {print $(NF-1)}')
wget $URL -O ./luci-theme-argon.ipk
opkg install luci-theme-argon.ipk

URL=$(wget -q https://api.github.com/repos/jerrykuku/luci-app-argon-config/releases/latest -O -
 | awk -F \" -v RS="," '/browser_download_url/ && /-config/ {print $(NF-1)}')
wget $URL -O ./luci-theme-argon-config-zh-cn.ipk
opkg install luci-theme-argon-config-zh-cn.ipk
```
You can config the theme style from `System -> Argon Config`.   
![192.168.167.1_cgi-bin_luci_admin_system_argon-config.png](https://www.cms.void-dojo.ninja/uploads/192_168_167_1_cgi_bin_luci_admin_system_argon_config_3f7e2ddb7c.png)
